intro: Paepalanthus accrescens, commonly known as the creeping buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Paepalanthus accrescens is an important plant in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological balance.
